name: Fill in the Weird Al Lyrics Online Trivia | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: "'Cause I'm the king of cellulite. Ham on, ham on, ham on whole wheat, all _____"
questions.explanation:
Right.

	The lyrics are from the song "Fat". The song was first released in 1988 on the album "Even Worse". The lyric is from the first stanza of the song.

Fantastic.

	From the song "Word Crimes", which was a parody of the Robin Thicke song "Blurred Lines". Yankovic's version was released in 2014 on the album "Mandatory Fun". Thicke is the son of the actor Alan Thicke.

questions.text: "Keep your 40. I'll just have an Earl Grey ____".
questions.explanation:
tea.

	Yes, Weird Al once included a line about drinking tea in a song. The song was "White & Nerdy" which was released in 2006. It was originally on the album "Straight Outta Linwood." In the song Yankovic sings about various things that happen to the narrator during his nerdy life.

questions.text: "Don't want no Captain Crunch, don't want no Raisin Bran. "Well, don't you know that other kids are starving in ____".
questions.explanation:
Japan.

	A parody of Michael Jackson's "Beat It", this parody song was called "Eat It". It was originally released on the album ""Weird Al" Yankovic in 3-D" which was released in 1984.

questions.text: "I met him in a swamp down in Dagobah. Where it bubbles all the time like a giant carbonated ____".
questions.explanation:
Soda.

	Soda was used to rhyme with Yoda over and over in the song also called "Yoda". Yankovic released the song in 1985 after the final movie in the first "Star Wars" trilogy was released. It was on the album "Dare to Be Stupid."

questions.text: "Think it's fun threatening waiters with a bad Yelp ____".
questions.explanation:
Review.

	From the song "Tacky". During the song, which was released in 2014. It was originally on the album "Mandatory Fun." It was a parody of the song "Happy". The music video also parodied the video for "Tacky" to double up the jokes.

questions.text: "We went to Theed to see the _____".
questions.explanation:
queen.

	From the song "The Saga Begins". This song was a parody of "American Pie", which was originally performed by Don McClean. Yankovic's version was released in 1999, the same year that the first movie in the second "Star Wars" trilogy was released. It was on the album "Running with Scissors".

dark.

	Released in conjunction with the movie of the same name, the same came out in 1993. The song was on the album "Alapalooza". It was nominated for a Grammy Award for Best Music Video, but lost out to 	"Love Is Strong" from the Rolling Stones.

questions.text: "Was it a ___ or a cat I saw?"
questions.explanation:
Car.

	In the song "Bob" (which incidentally is a name never mentioned in the song) Yankovic was confused and couldn't tell what he had seen. The song was originally released in 2003 on the album "Poodle Hat".  Every line in the song, and the title, was a palindrome, meaning it was the same forward and backward.

questions.text: "Crank the volume, ____ are bleedin'. I still don't know what I'm singin'"
questions.explanation:
Ears.

	The song was a parody of the grunge rock band Nirvana. It was titled "Smells like Nirvana". The tune was released in 1992 on the album "Off the Deep End". It was a parody of the Nirvana song "Smells Like Teen Spirit."
